ext_descriptions.ext_description: The area_unit_type is an extensible list of types of area that is used by .
the area type is circular;
the area type is square;
the area type is rectangular.
The collection_plane_orientation is an extensible list of orientations for a collection plane.
the collection plane is perpendicular to the referenced datum;
the collection plane is parallel to the referenced datum.
The common_datum_list is a list of . Unless otherwise specified, a common_datum_list shall be used in accordance with common datum as defined in ISO 5459.
The datum_or_common_datum type is a list of alternate data types. It provides a mechanism to refer to an instance of one of these data types.
The datum_reference_modifier_type is an extensible list of modifier types that is used by
the shape of the associated feature used to establish a datum is circular or cylindrical;
the shape of the associated feature used to establish a datum is spherical;
the shape of the associated feature used to establish a datum is two parallel planes;
the shape of the associated feature used to establish a datum is extended by a projected length as defined in ISO 5459.

The directed_tolerance_zone_type is an extensible list of modifier types that is used by
to indicate the direction of an "intersection plane".
indicates that the "intersection plane" is directed perpendicular to the referenced datum.
indicates that the "intersection plane" is directed parallel to the referenced datum.
indicates that the "intersection plane" is directed so that it includes the referenced datum.
The geometric_tolerance_modifier is the list of modifiers that is used by .

ext_description.p: indicates that maximum material requirement applies in accordance with ISO 2692 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for maximum material requirement is Ⓜ.

ext_description.p: indicates that least material requirement applies in accordance with ISO 2692 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for least material requirement is Ⓛ.

ext_description.p: indicates that reciprocity requirement applies in accordance with ISO 2692 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for reciprocity requirement is Ⓡ.

ext_description.p: indicates that any cross section applies in accordance with ISO 1101 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for any cross section is ACS.

ext_description.p: indicates that any any longitudinal section applies in accordance with ISO 5459 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for any cross section is ALS.

ext_description.p: indicates that the tolerance is a separate requirement;
ext_description.note: For ASME Y14.5-2009 [3] Y14.5-2009 this is indicated by SEP REQ.

ext_description.p: indicates that free state applies in accordance with ISO 10579 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for free state is Ⓕ.

ext_description.p: indicates that common zone applies in accordance with ISO 1101 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for common zone is CZ.

ext_description.p: indicates that minor diameter applies in accordance with ISO 1101 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for minor diameter is LD.

ext_description.p: indicates that major diameter applies in accordance with ISO 1101 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for major diameter is MD.

ext_description.p: indicates that pitch diameter applies in accordance with ISO 1101 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for pitch diameter is PD.

ext_description.p: indicates that line element applies in accordance with ISO 1101 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for line element is LE.

ext_description.p: indicates that not convex applies in accordance with ISO 1101 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for not convex is NC.

ext_description.p: indicates that the tolerance is based on statistical tolerances;
ext_description.note: For ASME Y14.5-2009 [3] Y14.5-2009 this is indicated by <ST>.

ext_description.p: indicates that the datum is the tangent plane established by contacting points;
ext_description.note: For ASME Y14.5-2009 [3] this is indicated by Ⓣ.

ext_description.p: indicates that the tolerance zone applies to each radial element individually.
ext_description.note: For ASME Y14.5-2009 [3] this is indicated by EACH RADIAL ELEMENT.

ext_description.p: indicates that united feature applies in accordance with ISO 1101 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for united feature is UF.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The oriented_tolerance_zone_type is a list of modifier types that is used by
to indicate the orientation of an "orientation plane".
indicates that the "orientation plane" is oriented perpendicular to the referenced datum.
indicates that the "orientation plane" is oriented parallel to the referenced datum.
indicates that the "orientation plane" is oriented under some specified angle to the referenced datum.
The simple_datum_reference_modifier is an extensible list of modifier symbols, which can be associated to the datum letter.

ext_description.p: indicates that free state applies in accordance with ISO 10579 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for free state is Ⓕ.

ext_description.p: indicates that the datum feature is simulated at the boundary defined by TEDs;
ext_description.note: For ASME Y14.5-2009 [3] this is indicated by "BSC" or "BASIC."

ext_description.p: indicates that the datum feature simulator is not fixed as its theoretically exact location and shall be free to translate;
ext_description.note: For ASME Y14.5-2009 [3] this is indicated by ▷.

ext_description.p: indicates that least material requirement applies in accordance with ISO 2692 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for least material requirement is Ⓛ.

ext_description.p: indicates that maximum material requirement applies in accordance with ISO 2692 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for maximum material requirement is Ⓜ.

ext_description.p: indicates that point applies in accordance with ISO 5459 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for point is [SP].

ext_description.p: indicates that line applies in accordance with ISO 5459 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for line is [SL].

ext_description.p: indicates that plane applies in accordance with ISO 5459 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for plane is [PL].

ext_description.p: indicates that orientation applies in accordance with ISO 5459 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for orientation is [OO].

ext_description.p: indicates that any cross section applies in accordance with ISO 5459 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for any cross section is [ACS].

ext_description.p: indicates that any longitudinal section applies in accordance with ISO 5459 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for any longitudinal section is [ALS].

ext_description.p: indicates that contacting feature applies in accordance with ISO 5459 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for contacting feature is [CF].

ext_description.p: indicates that distance variable applies in accordance with ISO 5459 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for distance variable is [DV].

ext_description.p: indicates that the degree of freedom in the x direction is constrained;
ext_description.note: For ASME Y14.5-2009 [3] this is indicated by "[x]."

ext_description.p: indicates that the degree of freedom in the y direction is constrained;
ext_description.note: For ASME Y14.5-2009 [3] this is indicated by "[y]."

ext_description.p: indicates that the degree of freedom in the z direction is constrained;
ext_description.note: For ASME Y14.5-2009 [3] this is indicated by "[z]."

ext_description.p: indicates that the degree of freedom in the u direction is constrained;
ext_description.note: For ASME Y14.5-2009 [3] this is indicated by "[u]."

ext_description.p: indicates that the degree of freedom in the v direction is constrained;
ext_description.note: For ASME Y14.5-2009 [3] this is indicated by "[v]."

ext_description.p: indicates that the degree of freedom in the w direction is constrained.
ext_description.note: For ASME Y14.5-2009 [3] this is indicated by "[w]."

ext_description.p: indicates that minor diameter applies in accordance with ISO 5459 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for minor diameter is [LD].

ext_description.p: indicates that major diameter applies in accordance with ISO 5459 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for major diameter is [MD].

ext_description.p: indicates that pitch diameter applies in accordance with ISO 5459 unless otherwise specified;
ext_description.note: The symbol for pitch diameter is [PD].

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The tolerance_zone_type is the list of tolerance zone shapes that is used by . tolerance_zone_type shall be used in accordance to tolerance zone as defined in ISO 1101.
the tolerance zone is the space within a circle;
the tolerance zone is the space between two concentric circles;
the tolerance zone is the space between two equidistant lines or two parallel straight lines;
the tolerance zone is the space within a cylinder
the tolerance zone is the space between two coaxial cylinders;
the tolerance zone is the space between two equidistant surfaces or two parallel planes;
the tolerance zone is is not one of the cases listed by ISO;
the tolerance zone is the space within a cylinder or circle;
the tolerance zone is the space within a sphere;
specifies that no information is available in the creating system.
An Affected_plane_tolerance_zone is a type of .

an inherited attribute shall be of type
for the Affected_plane_tolerance_zone. There shall exist at least one
for the Affected_plane_tolerance_zone.
a plane which defines the elements to which the tolerance is applied.
An All_around_shape_element is a type of .

An All_around_shape_element_along_collection_plane is a type of
that represents the "all around" concept of ISO 1101 along a spcified "collection plane".

specifies the
along which the "collection plane" is oriented.
specifies the angle of the collection plane to the .

An Angularity_tolerance is a type of
that is a constraint on the location of a surface, of a centre plane, of an edge, or of an axis that lies theoretically at a specified angle (other than 90 degrees) from a datum plane or from a datum axis.
Unless otherwise specified the rules governing angularity tolerance defined in ISO 1101 shall apply.
Alternatively angularity tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].
The specified angle shall not be a multiple of 90 degrees. In the case of 0 or 180 degrees, a
shall be used. In the case of 90 or 270 degrees, a
shall be used. The specified angle shall be defined using an instance of . The toleranced element is either a plane or a straight line.
An Angularity_tolerance specifies one of the following:
a tolerance zone defined by two parallel planes at the specified basic angle from one or more datum planes or a datum axis within which surface, centre plane or axis of the considered feature must lie;
a tolerance zone defined by a cylinder at the specified basic angle from one or more datum planes or a datum axis within which the considered feature must lie;
a tolerance zone defined by two parallel lines at the specified basic angle from a datum plane or axis within which the considered element of the feature must lie.

specifies the
for the Angularity_tolerance.

An Axis_placement_shape_element is a type of
that is associated with an .
specifies the associated .

A Plane_shape_element is a type of
that is assocated with a .
specifies the associated .

A Point_shape_element is a type of
that is assocated with a point .
specifies the associated .

A Between_shape_element is a type of
where some of the composing members are marked as forming elements of the borders of the continuous region.
a set of one or more features that identifies the start of the tolerance feature.
a set of one or more features that identifies the end of the tolerance feature.
all start_features shall be definitional.
all end_features shall be definitional.

A Circular_runout_tolerance is a type of
that constrains the deviation of features constructed about an axis or at right angles to an axis. Each measurement position, either along the axis, or away from the axis, is independently rotated through 360 degrees.
Unless otherwise specified, the rules governing circular run-out tolerance defined in ISO 1101 shall apply.
Alternatively circular run-out tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].

the direction in which the runout tolerance is controlled. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the angle is specified, the runout tolerance applies in this angle which is fixed with respect to the datum axis. If the angle is not specified, the runout tolerance applies normal to the surface generated by the rotation.

specifies the role of the
for the Circular_runout_tolerance.

ext_description.p:
A Coaxiality_tolerance is a type of
that constrains a centre point or plane of a surface of revolution, or of circular elements, about a datum feature.
ext_description.note: Some tolerancing standards require the use of position tolerance for control of coaxiality.
ext_description.p: Unless otherwise specified, the rules governing coaxiality tolerance defined in ISO 1101 shall apply.
ext_description.note: Alternatively coaxiality tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Coaxiality_tolerance.

A Concentricity_tolerance is a type of
that controls the median points of a surface of revolution relative to a datum axis.
Unless otherwise specified, the rules governing concentricity tolerance defined in ISO 1101 shall apply.
Alternatively concentricity tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].

specifies the role of the
for the Concentricity_tolerance.

A Contacting_feature is a type of
that is non-definitional and for which the rules governing contacting feature defined in ISO 5459 shall apply.
the Contacting_feature shall be non-definitional.

A Continuous_shape_element is a type of
where the geometric elements associated with the underlying
members are touching and thus establish a continuos region.

A Cylindricity_tolerance is a type of . It constrains the form of a cylindrical feature.
Unless otherwise specified, the rules governing cylindricity tolerance defined in ISO 1101 shall apply.
Alternatively cylindricity tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].

ext_description.p:
A Datum is a type of
from which dimensions and tolerances are referenced. This
may, but need not, coincide with the boundary defining the product. A Datum is a datum as specified in ISO 5459. The application of Datum shall conform to the requirements of ISO 5459.
ext_description.note:
The use and application of a group of features to establish a Datum is identified in ISO 5459. The group of features is established through the use of
objects. The concept of a group of Shape_elements is defined in .
A Datum is a theoretically exact point, straight line, or plane used as a reference for locating and orienting tolerance zones.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the identifier that distinguishes the Datum.

A Datum_axis is a type of
and a type of
that is a theoretically exact axis to which toleranced Shape_elements are related.

ext_description.p:
A Datum_feature is a type of
on the boundary of the shape of a product. In the case that the Datum_feature is a feature of size either one of the subtype
or
shall be used. Unless otherwise specified, the rules governing datum feature defined in ISO 5459 shall apply.
ext_description.note: Alternatively datum feature can be used according to the specifications given in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
to which the Datum_feature belongs to.
the Datum_feature shall be non-definitional.
The of_datum shall be unique within a population of Datum_feature.

A Datum_plane is a type of
that is a theoretically exact plane to which toleranced
are related.
an inherited attribute shall be of type .

A Datum_point is a type of
that is a theoretically exact point to which toleranced
are related.
an inherited attribute shall be of type .

A Datum_reference_compartment is a type of
that represents the compartment of either the primary, secondary or tertiary datum in a feature control frame.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Datum_reference_compartment is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Datum_reference_compartment as its .

specfies the
for the Datum_reference_compartment.

specfies the
for the Datum_reference_compartment.

specfies the
for the Datum_reference_compartment.

ext_description.p:
A Datum_reference_element is a type of
that represents a single datum reference of a common datum with a . Unless otherwise specified, the rules governing common datum defined in ISO 5459 shall apply.
ext_description.note: Alternatively comon datum can be used according to the specifications given in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
to which this Datum_reference_element belongs to.
The usage shall not be the same instance of Datum_reference_element.
The usage shall exist.

ext_description.p: A Datum_reference_modifier_with_value is an association between a modifier_type and a modifier_value that defines the specific boundary size of the associated feature for establishing a datum. In the case of a circular, cylindrical or spherical boundary type the value represents the diameter of the boundary. In the case of a distance the value represents the distance between two parallel planes.
ext_description.note: When used for ASEM Y14.5-2009 [x] a Datum_reference_modifier_with_value represents the datum feature simulator boundary.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Datum_reference_modifier_with_value.

specifies the role of the
for the Datum_reference_modifier_with_value.

ext_description.p:
A Datum_system is a type of
that is non-definitional and that represents the ordered collection of one to three datum reference compartments within a geometric tolerance frame. Unless otherwise specified a Datum_system shall be used in accordance to the ISO 5459 definition for single datum and datum system.
ext_description.note: Alternatively Datum_system might be used for the corresponding concept in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3] or any later edition of this standard.
A Datum_system can be associated with a model coordinate system and can be shared by several Geometric_tolerances.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the ordered list of one to three
representing the primary and optionally the secondary and tertiary datum of a tolerance frame.
the Datum_system shall be non-definitional.

A Datum_system_with_associated_model_coordinate_system is a type of
and a type of
to represent the relation between a datum system and a model coordinate system as defined in ISO 16792. The model coordinate system is represented by an
that is referenced by the inherited attribute .

A Datum_target is a type of . A Datum_target is a datum target as specified in ISO 5459. The application of Datum_target shall conform to the requirements of ISO 5459.
A Datum_target is the identification of a portion of a feature, that is used in the construction of a
when it is not desired to use an entire feature nor a substantial region.
A cylindrical part is stabilized for measurement by resting it in a V block, thereby establishing a
from two instances of Datum_target, which are straight lines.
Each Datum_target is either a , a , or a .
the identifier of the Datum_target.

specifies the
for the Datum_target. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the
to which the Datum_target belongs to.

specifies the
for the Datum_target. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
The combination of of_datum and target_id shall be unique within a population of Datum_target.

A Dimensional_location_with_datum_feature is a type of
and type of
that shall be used when the datum is established from two opposing
that define a feature of size.

A Dimensional_size_with_datum_feature is a type of
and type of
that shall be used when the datum is established by a single
that defines a feature of size.

A Directed_or_oriented_tolerance_zone is a type of
that includes additional direction or orientation information for the tolerance zone. A Directed_or_oriented_tolerance_zone shall be either a
or an .

an inherited attribute whose value shall be of type , , , ,
or .

A Directed_tolerance_zone is a type of
that represents an "intersection plane" for a geometric tolerance as defined in ISO 1101.
specified the direction of the tolerance zone in respect to the referenced datum. It is either , or .

A Oriented_tolerance_zone is a type of
that represents an "orientation plane" for a geometric tolerance as defined in ISO 1101.
specified the orientation of the tolerance zone in respect to the referenced datum. It is either , or .
specified an additional angle of the tolerance zone orientation in respect to the referenced datum.

An
value shall only be specified if and only if the
is of type .

ext_description.p:
A Flatness_tolerance is a type of
that constraints the form of a planar feature. Unless otherwise specified, the rules governing flatness tolerance defined in ISO 1101 shall apply.
ext_description.note: Alternatively flatness tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A General_datum_reference is a type of
that is non-definitional and that represents the ocurrence of a
within a . Each General_datum_reference is either a
or a .

specifies the used
for the General_datum_reference.

specifies the role of the
for the General_datum_reference. There shall exist at least one
for the General_datum_reference.
the General_datum_reference shall be non-definitional.

A Geometric_tolerance is a specification of the allowed deviation of some element of the shape of a product from its theoretically exact shape. Each Geometric_tolerance is either an , a , a , a , a , a , a , a , a , a , a , a , a , a , or a
the identification of the Geometric_tolerance. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the identification of the geometrical tolerance type.
ext_description.note: This identification may be one of the geometrical tolerance types specified in ISO 1101 when used to represent International Standard geometrical tolerances.
ext_description.example: Position, straightness, concentricity, parallelism, circular runout, etc., are names for geometrical tolerance types.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
to which the Geometric_tolerance is associated.

specifies the role of the
for the Geometric_tolerance. There shall exist at least one
for the Geometric_tolerance.

ext_description.p: a text that provides additional information about the Geometric_tolerance.
ext_description.example: 'not concave', 'boundary' are examples of qualifying note.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: a length of a segment that constrains how the tolerance applies. All along any segment of this size, taken on the toleranced element, the toleranced element shall conform to the tolerance. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the role of the
for the Geometric_tolerance. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the role of the
for the Geometric_tolerance. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the value of the width of the tolerance zone. The meaning of this value will depend on the standard used for the interpretation of the geometric tolerance.

specifies the role of the
for the Geometric_tolerance. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
If specified, the first_unit_size shall be a value of a length measure.
If specified, the tolerance_value shall be a value of a length measure.

A Geometric_tolerance_relationship is a relationship between two instances of .
The meaning of the relationship is specified within the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li:
composite: For two adjacent segments the relating
is the upper one while the related one is the lower one. A chain of Geometric_tolerance_relationships may be used to construct a composite of s with more than 2 elements.
This capability is to be used for representing composite positional tolerancing as defined in ASME Y14.5-2009.

simultaneity: The relating and the related
shall be met simultaneously, when they reference the same .

ext_description.p: Other kinds of relationships may be specified if appropriate to a particular tolerancing system.
ext_description.example: The position tolerance of a each feature of a pattern of features may be specified with a , and the relationships between the features in the pattern may be specified by another.

A different position tolerance may be specified for each end of a long hole. A Geometric_tolerance_relationship could be used to express that an interpolated value applies at intermediate points, thus creating a conical tolerance zone.

ext_description.p:
one of the instances of
that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p:
the other instance of
that is a part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p:
A Line_profile_tolerance is a type of
that specifies the definition of a uniform boundary along the true profile within which the elements of the toleranced surface shall lie. The tolerance zone established by a Line_profile_tolerance is two dimensional.
Unless otherwise specified, the rules governing profile tolerance defined in ISO 1101 shall apply.
ext_description.note: Alternatively profile tolerance of a line can be used according to the specifications given in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Line_profile_tolerance. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Line_profile_tolerance is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Line_profile_tolerance as its . There shall exist at most one
for the Line_profile_tolerance.

ext_description.p: A Non_uniform_zone_definition is a type of . The boundaries of a Non_uniform_zone_definition may have any shape.
ext_description.note: Non-uniform zone is described in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Parallelism_tolerance is a type of
that specifies that a surface or a curve shall be parallel to a reference datum, with an allowed amount of deviation. A Parallelism_tolerance specifies one of the following:
a tolerance zone limited by two planes or two lines (if the attribute directed_or_oriented_tolerance_zone is specified) parallel to a datum plane, or axis, within which the line elements of the surface or the axis of the considered feature must lie;
a cylindrical tolerance zone whose axis is parallel to a datum axis within which the axis of the considered feature must lie. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
Unless otherwise specified, the rules governing parallelism tolerance defined in ISO 1101 shall apply.
Alternatively parallelism tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].

specifies the role of the
for the Parallelism_tolerance.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Parallelism_tolerance is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Parallelism_tolerance as its . There shall exist at most one
for the Parallelism_tolerance.

specifies the role of the
for the Perpendicularity_tolerance.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Perpendicularity_tolerance is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Perpendicularity_tolerance as its . There shall exist at most one
for the Perpendicularity_tolerance.

A Placed_target is a type of
that specifies a
that is represented implicitly by parameters. Each Placed_target is either a , a , a , a , or a .

the in which the
that serves as parameter_reference is defined.
the to which the parameters or the Placed_target refer.

A Position_tolerance is a type of
that controls the position of a
that is a feature of size. It can be interpreted either as defining a positional boundary within which the entire feature is permitted to lie, or as defining a tolerance zone within which the centre, axis, or centre plane of the considered
is permitted to lie.
Basic theoretically exact dimensions establish the true position from specified datum features and between interrelated features.
Unless otherwise specified, the tolerance shall be used in accordance with position tolerance in ISO 1101 and ISO 5458.
The location of the tolerance zone shall be specified with instances of .
Alternatively position tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].
When the toleranced shape element is a , e.g. eight holes, the tolerance zone may but need not be defined by referenced datums (see ISO 1101).
The type
is defined in ISO 10303-47.

specifies the role of the
for the Position_tolerance. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Position_tolerance is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Position_tolerance as its . There shall exist at most one
for the Position_tolerance.

A Projected_zone_definition is a type of . It specifies a condition where a
is projected from an element of a part. The projection is external to the part and made from one of the ends of the element for a specified length.
Unless otherwise specified, the rules governing projected tolerance zone defined in ISO 1101 shall apply.
the from which the tolerance zone is projected.

the distance from the projection_end to where the
shall be measured.
A Projected_zone_definition_with_offset is a type of . A Projected_zone_definition_with_offset is used when the origin of the projected tolerance zone is offset from the reference surface.
specifies the value of the offset.

A Roundness_tolerance is a type of
that specifies a tolerance zone bounded by two concentric circles within which each circular element of a surface must lie. For a sphere, a circular element is all points of the surface intersected by any plane passing through a common center. For other surfaces, a circular element is all points of the surface intersected by any plane perpendicular to an axis. The Roundness_tolerance condition applies independently at any plane.
Unless otherwise specified, the rules governing roundness tolerance defined in ISO 1101 shall apply.
Alternatively roundness tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].

ext_description.p:
A Runout_zone_definition is a type of
that is defined by the orientation of the measurement of the toleranced
to the
of a datum feature.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
an angle value that orients the tolerance zone from the centre of symmetry of a datum feature to which the runout zone is applied, or a specific value that is the normal to the surface of the
that is applied to the runout tolerance.

the
which specifies a directed relationship from the
to the
to define the reference direction in which the angle is to be oriented. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Situation_feature is a type of
and a type of
that is non-definitional. Each Situation_feature is either a , a , or a .

the
to which the Situation_feature belongs to.

A Straightness_tolerance is a type of
that specifies a tolerance zone within which the considered element of a feature or a derived median line must lie. Unless otherwise specified, the rules governing straightness tolerance defined in ISO 1101 shall apply.
Alternatively straightness tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].
The toleranced shape element is a surface or a straight line. Refer to the definition of straightness tolerance in ISO 1101 for a description of the different tolerance zones. In the case of intersection curves, the ideal features corresponding to the intersection curves shall be linear and there shall be another , which is related to the toleranced shape element by a .

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Straightness_tolerance is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Straightness_tolerance as its . There shall exist at most one
for the Straightness_tolerance.

A Surface_profile_tolerance is a type of
that is the definition of a uniform boundary along an ideal profile within which the elements of a surface must lie.
The tolerance zone established by a Surface_profile_tolerance is three dimensional, extending along the length and the width of the considered feature as a whole respectively along each segment of a defined size if the
attribute is specified. If the tolerance is to be unequally disposed about the theoretically exact feature, a
having only one boundary element is associated to the instance of Surface_profile_tolerance.
Unless otherwise specified, the rules governing profile any surface tolerance defined in ISO 1101 shall apply.
Alternatively profile tolerance of a surface can be used according to the specifications given in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].

specifies the role of the
for the Surface_profile_tolerance. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Symmetry_tolerance is a type of
that is a constraint on the amount of deviation a toleranced element may have from being symmetrical to a datum. Any edge or (median) plane of the part must lie in a tolerance zone limited by two parallel lines or planes, symmetrically located with respect to a datum.
Unless otherwise specified, the rules governing symmetry tolerance defined in ISO 1101 shall apply.
Alternatively symmetry tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].

specifies the role of the
for the Symmetry_tolerance.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Symmetry_tolerance is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Symmetry_tolerance as its . There shall exist at most one
for the Symmetry_tolerance.

A Target_area is a type of
that specifies an area bounded by a closed . The shape of the Target_area is described explicitly by a set of curves with reference to the part coordinate system.

specifies the
that represents the Target_area.

A Target_circle is a type of
that specifies a
that is defined by an implicit circle. The may be the area inside the circle or the circle, depending on the geometry. The centre of the circle is specified by the placing . The orientation of the Target_circle is the x-y-plane of the .
the diameter of the datum target.

A Target_circular_curve is a type of
that specifies a
that is defined by an implicit circular curve. The centre of the circle is specified by the placing . The orientation of the
is the x-y-plane of the .
the diameter of the datum target.

A Target_curve is a type of
that is specified by a single curve.

specifies the
that represents the Target_curve.

A Target_point is a type of
that specifies a
that is defined by a single implicit point. The position of the Target_point is defined by the placing .

A Target_rectangle is a type of
that specifies a
that is defined by an implicit rectangle.
The centre of the rectangle is specified by the placing . The orientation of the Target_rectangle is the x-y-plane with half the length of the rectangle in positive and half the length in negative direction along the x-axis and with half the width of the rectangle in positive and half the width in negative direction along the y-axis of the .
the length of the Target_rectangle.
the width of the Target_rectangle

A Target_straight_line is a type of
that specifies a
that is defined by an implicit straight line. The first end point of the Target_straight_line is specified by the placing . The second end point is located on the z-axis of the
at the specified distance.
the length of the Target_straight_line.

A Tolerance_zone is a type of
that represents a tolerance zone as defined in ISO 1101. A Tolerance_zone is the region within which the toleranced feature shall be defined. The characteristics of the region are specified by the manner in which the toleranced feature is dimensioned.
A geometric location tolerance applied to a hole defines a
referenced by form_type.
the kind of shape of the Tolerance_zone.

the set of
objects for which the Tolerance_zone defines the zone. There shall exist at least one
for the Tolerance_zone.

A Tolerance_zone_definition is the specification of the set of Geometric_tolerances for which the defines the zone. Each Tolerance_zone_definition may be either a , a , or a .
A pair of boundaries specified as a single Tolerance_zone_definition may form either a partial or complete tolerance zone. When the tolerance zone is not fully bounded, it is appropriate to assume that the tolerance zone extends to infinity at the unbounded areas.
A flatness tolerance zone of a planar surface is bounded by two parallel, infinite planes separated by a distance of the tolerance magnitude.
the that is specified by the Tolerance_zone_definition.

ext_description.p: the set of Shape_elements that define boundaries of the . There shall exist zero or more Shape_elements for the Tolerance_zone_definition.
ext_description.example:
A geometric location tolerance applied to a hole is defined to be a cylindrical zone in which the axis of the hole may vary. The cylindrical zone is symmetric about its axis. The two defining boundaries of this tolerance zone are the cylindrical surface and its axis. For a
defined by two parallel planes (or lines), each plane (or line) defines a boundary of the Tolerance_zone_definition.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Tolerance_zone_with_datum is a type of
that includes direction or orientation classification with respect to referenced features.
Typically only a primary datum is used.

the
which serves as the geometric reference for the Tolerance_zone_with_datum orientation.

A Total_runout_tolerance is a type of
that constrains the deviation features constructed about an axis or at right angles to an axis. It constrains the deviation over a surface with respect to a datum axis the part is rotated about. The tolerance is applied simultaneously to all measuring positions as the part is rotated 360 degrees.
Unless otherwise specified the rules governing total run-out tolerance defined in ISO 1101 shall apply.
Alternatively total run-out tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASME Y14.5-2009 [3].
The set of referenced datums shall contain one revolute surface feature. The tolerance zone is limited either by:
two coaxial cylinders, with a difference in radii equal to the tolerance value. In this case, the axis of the cylinders shall be the axis of the revolute surface feature, and the ideal feature corresponding to the toleranced surface is a cylinder;
two parallel planes, separated by the distance specified by the tolerance value. In this case, the planes are perpendicular to the axis of the revolute surface feature, and the ideal feature corresponding to the toleranced surface is a plane.
the direction with respect to the datum axis in which a runout tolerance is controlled.

specifies the role of the
for the Total_runout_tolerance.

shall not be simultaneously of type , , .

The gl_shape_element_subtypes constraint specifies that instances of subtypes of
shall not be simultaneously of type , , .

The gl_associated_shape_element_subtypes constraint specifies that instances of subtypes of
shall not be simultaneously of type , , .

associated with the
as an input.
